deck: A peaceful place of research and education. Home of Jim Lockhart (the former Red Torpedo), the Sea Devils, Elsa Magnusson (widow of Mark Merlin) and the ghost of Vulko.
description:
After World War I and World War II, U.S. Navy Captain Jim Lockhart (also known as the golden age hero Red Torpedo) started a company, Lockhart Navionics. Lockhart Navionics made Lockhart billions of dollars, which he dedicated to helping the world. At Lockhart Navionics, Lockhart created Windward Home, a mobile seafaring city that he ran with his second-in-command, Elsa Magnusson. Lockhart and Magnusson created Wayward Home as a mobile think tank, which brought together scientists and scholars from across the Earth into an environment free from life’s daily trials. Since Windward Home operates in international waters, the inhabitants are subject to no one nation’s laws. Windward Home’s inhabitants come from all the races of Earth, including some aliens and at least one inhabitant of Feithera. Their research covers all topics, from technology to sorcery.
 
The Windward Home eventually found itself the home of the Sea Devils. In addition, once the Spectre destroyed Atlantis, some Atlanteans came to Lockhart’s Windward Home, including the ghost of Vulko. A.J. Curry and King Shark joined Vulko at Windward Home to help search for Aquaman, but left shortly after when they discovered Aquaman’s dead body.
name: Windward Home

deck: Built by Prodigy, this cave is similar to the Danger Room in that it uses holograms in order to facilitate training. Also used as a base of operations for the Young X-Men.
description:
New X-Men

The Danger Cave was first introduced in New X-Men #21. It was built by Prodigy, using skills he obtained by being around Hank McCoy and Kitty Pryde. This was originally built with the intention of being used as an additional training device for his New X-Men teammates. However, after M-Day drastically decreased the amount of students attending the school, the cave was rarely used.
 
In the few instances the Danger Cave was utilized in New X-Men, the New X-Men and the Hellions relived some classic X-Men battles. The classic battles depicted by the Danger Cave consisted of Fall of the Mutants, X-Men vs. the Brood, a battle with a Nimrod, and Inferno.  
 

Young X-Men

The Danger Cave also made an appearance as a base of operations in the first arc of Young X-Men, Final Genesis. The cave was shown to be large enough to house a couple of jets that the team used to confront some of the New Mutants. The Cave was also shown to have a cell that was used to briefly imprison Magma.  
 
The most notable use of the Danger Cave's holographic cabalities came after Magma heated the sand that Dust is composed of, turning her to glass. The Young X-Men attempted to use the A.I. versions of Beast, Nightcrawler, Reed Richards, and Moira MacTaggert to cure Dust's condition, however the A.I. just couldn't come up with a viable solution.
name: Danger Cave

deck: PS238 is the codename for "The School for Metaprodigy Children" where superpowered children or "prodigies" come to learn.  This includes the sons and daughters of the world's greatest superheroes and most infamous supervillains.
description:
PS238 started as a comic done by Aaron Williams. It has shifted from comics to the web.

PS238 is an elementary school for children with super powers. Most of the characters are child versions or children of thinly disguised pastiche versions of famous superheroes, villians, or television characters (including Superman, Hulk, Doctor Doom, the Doctor (Dr. Who), etc) and other pastiches play recurring guest roles, such as the Revanant (not Batman, wink wink).

While various children play large roles, the main character is Tyler Marlocke, later known as Moon Shadow. Tyler is placed at the school even though he has no super-powers. But his parents are powerful superheroes and they are convinced he will have some when he gets old enough. He provides the stories with a common man perspective (well common child anyway).

issue_credits.name: The Amazing Adventures of the Uncanny Incredible Perfectly Ordinary Average Boy!

deck: Within The Dreaming there is a Library in which the forgotten works of the world are kept. Some of these works are stories dreamed but never written down. Lucien of The Dreaming is the primary caretaker of this one of a kind Library.
description:
Lucien dedicates his life to books and stories. He is the chief librarian of the Library in the realm of The Dreaming. Lucien also serves as the right hand man to Dream of the Endless (Both Morpheus and Daniel) and this library serves as his head office.

The library now is stable again with Daniel being in power. During Morpheus' reign The Library became lost when Morpheus was held captive on earth. With the stability back Lucien and many other of the Dreaming are helping to fill this Library again with forgotten and undreamed lore.

deck: A popular comic book shop in real world Santa Cruz, California.
description:
Comciopolis is a brick-and-mortar comic book store in Santa Cruz, CA that has been operating since 1997. It is located on Front Street, behind local bookseller Bookshop Santa Cruz. Comicopolis sells a wide variety of comics, including single-issues, grpahic novels, omnibuses and trade paperbacks from the majority of comics publishers. New and used comics are available for sale.  
 
Additionally, Comicopolis offers classes on many aspects of comics and cartooning. More details are available on their website.

Location

  
829 Front Street, 
Santa Cruz, CA 95060  
Tel: (831) 427-1929       
Comicopolis

11am - 6pm


Wednesday (New Comic Day): 

10am - 7pm


Thursday - Saturday: 

11am - 7pm

 
 

Comic Vine Ambassadors  


  • phildini
name: Comicopolis

deck: A popular comic book shop in real world Santa Cruz, California.
description:
Established in 1976, Atlantis Fantasyworld has been the premier brick-and-mortar store for comic media in Santa Cruz, CA. Atlantis has been run from three different locations over the course of its life (including the corner or a pavilion tent after the Loma Prieta quake of 1989) before finally settling into its home at the top of Cedar Street in downtown Santa Cruz. Atlantis Fantasyworld offers comics of diverse formats from almost all major publishers, including single issues, graphic novels, omnibus collections, special editions, and trade paperbacks. Of particular note is their collection of Silver- and Bronze-age single issues, many of them quite rare and all in excellent condition. Additionally, Atlantis offers high-quality memorabilia from a multitude of franchises, and often holds deals with the legal movie theater to give discounts on items related to the most recent blockbuster.

Atlantis Fantasyworld was the location of the comic store featured in the 1987 film "The Lost Boys".

Winner of the 1996 Will Eisner Spirit of Comics Retailer Award.

Location

1020 Cedar St

Santa Cruz, CA 95060

Atlantis Fantasyworld

Hours

Mon-Tues 10-6

Wed-Sat 10-7

Sunday 11-6

deck: R'lyeh, the nightmare corpse-city.
description:
"The nightmare corpse-city of R'lyeh…was built in measureless eons behind history by the vast, loathsome shapes that seeped down from the dark stars. There lay great Cthulhu and his hordes, hidden in green slimy vaults.” — H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthulhu

R'lyeh is the ancient undersea city in which "dead Cthulhu waits dreaming". It raises above the water when the "stars are right", awakening Cthulhu in the process. The geometry of R'lyeh is said to be non-Euclidean, which means that parallel lines curve away or towards each other. It is located in the southern Pacific Ocean at 47°9'S 126°43'W, close to the Pacific Pole of Inaccessibility (the point in the ocean farthest from any land).

deck: Arkham is a fictional city, created by H.P. Lovecraft..
description:
Arkham is a fictional city in Massachusetts, USA. It was created by the writer H.P. Lovecraft as a location to base many of his stories. He appears to have based his descriptions of Arkham on the real-life Salem, often describing it as "witch-cursed" and "legend-haunted". 
 
The city is known for its also-fictional Miskatonic University, as well as Arkham Sanitarium, which happens to be the inspiration for DC Comics' Arkham Asylum.

deck: The famed location of The Maxx. Sam Kieth's creative muse location where his dreams come to life in the land of Australia.
description:
The Outback

According to Sam Kieth this is in Australia. It is not the one we learn in textbooks and in school, but the "Real" Outback. Where weird and exciting creatures roam.

The Maxx

In the series the Maxx, the Outback would be the place where "Maxx" would protect his Jungle Queen. This version of the Outback would first be found in Darker Image #1.

Once someone goes to the Outback, their appearance changes. Julie Winter's of the series The Maxx is The Queen of The Outback.

The word "CHUNG!" ties into The Maxx being transported to the Outback.

The Isz and other life on the Outback

The Isz

The Isz are the most famous of all the creatures of the Outback. There are two kinds of Isz, the white and the black. The white are the native species to the Outback.

They were friendly creatures in their earlier appearances in The Critters. It is not been officially established if those Isz were related to these Isz.

The Isz have become a pest to The Maxx.

Other Media

The Maxx on MTV's Oddities

The Outback is present in the animated adaptation of The Maxx as well.
name: Sam Kieth's Outback

deck: A floating artificial island created by Stingray to function as an oceanography research facility. It later became the base of operations for the Avengers and was re-christened "Avengers Island".
description:
When the Avengers were told they could no longer use their Quinjets in Manhattan, due to lack of official clearance, Stingray contacted the team and offered them the opportunity to store their Quinjets on Hydrobase. As a token of gratitude, Stingray was awarded reserve membership with the team.

Following a subsequent attack on Avengers Mansion in Manhattan by the Masters of Evil, the Avengers decided to permanently relocate their operations and their mansion to Hydrobase.

After housing the Avengers for an extended period of time, Hydrobase was eventually destroyed by Doctor Doom and his robotic army when they attacked the island during Acts of Vengeance. The island sunk to the bottom of the ocean. Although both Quasar and Sub-Mariner tried to help Stingray salvage much of the island, their attempts were mostly fruitless.

At some point, the island was raised from the ocean floor, although remained unused and unmaintained afterwards. The artificial island, mostly ruins by this point, were later used as a meeting place for the Illuminati.

deck: When San Diego suffered an Earthquake, its western coast plunged into the sea and its inhabitants were given the ability to breathe underwater.
description: In order to save the people of San Diego, now at the bottom of the sea floor, Anton Geist is able to alter their physiology in order to allow them to breathe underwater. Cal Durham now serves as the mayor of Sub Diego. It is also the home of current Aquagirl, Lorena Marquez, who Aquaman takes in after her parents are killed in the Earthquake. Alonzo Malrey was a San Diego cop, but when part of it falls into the ocean he asks Anton Geist to turn him into an aquatic being in order to continue his work. The population consists of a mix of these altered humans and Atlantean refugees.

deck: Home world of Symon Terrynce, Green Lantern of Sector 2515. A world where the power of the mind is respected and prized above all else. A world where creating life with mere thoughts is a child's game.
description: Tanjent is a world of high standards.  All citizens were expected to master the powers of the mind.  Citizens who were not able to conform to this expectation were deemed unfit.  These citizens were usually exiled from the planet.  In a twist of poetic justice, these same exiles were the saviors of the planet.  Symon Terrynce was rocketed to the planet's moon by his father because he did not meet the standard.  Terrynce's will to live caught the eye of the Guardians of the Universe.  He was given a power ring and became the Green Lantern of Sector 2515.  During his first patrol in the sector, he came across as hostile exchange between his homeworld and some ships in orbit.  Once the situation was diffused, it was revealed the ships carried other people exiled from Tanjent.  These exiles had prevented an invasion on the satellite they were sent to.

deck: The Avengers Compound is a 15 acre estate located at 1800 Pales Verdes Drive on the Pacific coastline south of Los Angeles, California. It was the former headquarters of the West Coast Avengers and later the Avengers Academy
description:
Brief History

The former home of silent movie star Sylvia Powell, the Avengers purchased the compound and made it their base of operations for Hawkeye's West Coast Avengers. The compound was built in 1921 and features a number of Mediterranean style bungalows as well as the main estate. The Compound was renovated with two sub-basements containing hospital facilities, a state of the art research laboratory, communications and computing arrays and a Quinjet hanger with an underground runway running from the compound to the Pacific Ocean cliffs. The Compound featured many defensive and offensive security measures. In addition, the olympic swimming pool, personal bungalows, private beach, and expansive natural foliage made the compound a comfortable and lavish home for the West Coast branch. The compound was destroyed during one of the AWC later missions right before the team disbanded.

Following the events of Fear Itself, Hank Pym relocated the Avengers Academy and its students to the compound as their new headquarters.

deck: Hometown of Aqualad, Jackson Hyde and the location in which the White Lantern appeared.
description:
After the event known as the Blackest Night, a White Lantern appeared in the small town of Silver City, New Mexico. Unable to be moved, the White Lantern caught the attention of Sinestro, who quickly brought Hal Jordan and Carol Ferris to it's location.

Silver City is also the hometown of the new Aqualad, Jackson Hyde, who resides there with his adopted parents.

Trivia Fact: Silver City, New Mexico is one of the few DC locations which has a real world counterpart.
name: Silver City, New Mexico

deck: A run down manor occupied by various monsters and spooks.
description:
The Ghastly Manor comic strip featured in The Topper.
 
Mr. Fear, the owner of Ghastly Manor, is desprate to sell the place. Unfortunately for him the many protenial buyers are somewhat put off by the fact it's haunted by the many spooks and ghosts. On top of that is the various unspeakable horrors, mutants and monsters make their residence there.
name: Ghastly Manor

deck: One of the Nine Worlds and home of the Light Elves.
description:
Alfheim exists on the highest level of the World Tree along with Asgard and Vaneheim. Little is known about this realm. Its inhabitants are the light elves. The few appearances of the light elves have shown them to be peaceful, friendly, happy beings with few if any weapons. Physically their shape ranges from physically looking like humans with pointed ears to slightly more alien shapes. The general climate of the realm has been shown two different extremes. Most of the time it has been shown to have a spring, temperate climate. Forests have been observed.

The other extreme has shown Alfheim to be a land of ice and snow. The elves look like the elves of lore, but blue. It is unknown of this change was brought about due to the rebirth of Ragnarok or if this was another section of Alfheim. The blue light elves share many of the same characteristics of the others being peaceful, playful, friendly beings.
